edu.rit.numeric

Class Root

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.numeric.Root
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RootBisection

    public abstract class Root
extends Object
    Class Root is the abstract base class for an object that finds roots of a Function. Given a real-valued function of a real-valued variable f(x), an instance of a subclass of class Root finds a value x such that f(x) = 0.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Root(Function func)
      Construct a new object to find roots of the given function.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract double findRoot(Function func, Bracket brack, double tol)
      Find a root of func.f() in the bracketing interval brack.x1 to brack.x2 with tolerance tol.
      double root(Bracket brack)
      Find a root of the function in the given bracketing interval.
      double root(Bracket brack, double tol)
      Find a root of the function in the given bracketing interval to the given tolerance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Root

        public Root(Function func)
        Construct a new object to find roots of the given function.
        Parameters:
        func - Function.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if func is null.

    • Method Detail

      • root

        public final double root(Bracket brack)
        Find a root of the function in the given bracketing interval. The root() method calls the brack.bracket() method to find the bracketing interval; typically brack is a newly constructed instance of a subclass of class Bracket. A tolerance of ε(|x1| + |x2|)/2 is used, where ε is the machine precision and the bracketing interval is x1 to x2.
        Parameters:
        brack - Bracketing interval object.
        Returns:
        Root of func.f(x).

      • root

        public final double root(Bracket brack,
          double tol)
        Find a root of the function in the given bracketing interval to the given tolerance. The root() method calls the brack.bracket() method to find the bracketing interval; typically brack is a newly constructed instance of a subclass of class Bracket.
        Parameters:
        brack - Bracketing interval object.
        tol - Tolerance.
        Returns:
        Root of func.f(x).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if tol ≤ 0.

      • findRoot

        protected abstract double findRoot(Function func,
              Bracket brack,
              double tol)
        Find a root of func.f() in the bracketing interval brack.x1 to brack.x2 with tolerance tol. Function values at the bracketing interval endpoints are brack.f_x1 and brack.f_x2.
        Parameters:
        func - Function.
        brack - Bracketing interval object.
        tol - Tolerance.
        Returns:
        Root of func.f(x).
